homes_hear_details: Delaware has not yet launched its HOMES or HEAR rebate programs. The Delaware Division of Climate, Coastal and Energy within the Department of Natural Resources and Environmental Control (DNREC) is the designated administrator working with the U.S. Department of Energy on program implementation.
state_energy_office: Delaware Division of Climate, Coastal and Energy (DNREC)

income_thresholds.low_income_80_ami: For Delaware, 80% of Area Median Income varies by county. In New Castle County (Wilmington metro), 80% AMI for a family of four is approximately $68,650.
income_thresholds.moderate_income_150_ami: For Delaware, 150% of Area Median Income in New Castle County for a family of four is approximately $128,700.

net_metering: Delaware has net metering under Delaware Code Title 26, Section 1014. Residential systems up to 25 kW qualify. Customers receive credits at the full retail rate. Excess credits roll forward monthly for up to 12 months. The state also has a renewable portfolio standard requiring 40% renewable energy by 2035, including a solar carve-out.

state_rebate_programs.name: Energize Delaware - Green Energy Program Rebates
state_rebate_programs.administrator: Delaware Sustainable Energy Utility (DESEU) / Energize Delaware
state_rebate_programs.amount: Up to $3,000 for heat pumps; up to $500 for heat pump water heaters; up to $300 for smart thermostats and other measures
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Air source heat pumps, heat pump water heaters, smart thermostats, insulation, air sealing, duct sealing, ENERGY STAR appliances
state_rebate_programs.details: Energize Delaware is the state's comprehensive energy efficiency and renewable energy program, administered by the Delaware Sustainable Energy Utility. Rebate amounts and availability vary by technology and may change.

state_rebate_programs.name: Energize Delaware - Home Performance with ENERGY STAR
state_rebate_programs.amount: Up to $4,000 for comprehensive home energy improvements
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Comprehensive package of insulation, air sealing, HVAC upgrades, duct sealing, and other measures identified through a home energy audit
state_rebate_programs.details: Requires a certified home energy audit. Rebate amount depends on projected energy savings. Must use a participating BPI-certified contractor.

state_rebate_programs.name: Weatherization Assistance Program
state_rebate_programs.administrator: Delaware Division of Climate, Coastal and Energy
state_rebate_programs.amount: Free comprehensive weatherization for qualifying households
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Insulation, air sealing, HVAC repair/replacement, duct sealing, water heater measures
state_rebate_programs.details: For income-qualifying households at or below 200% of federal poverty level.

state_rebate_programs.name: Delaware Green Energy Fund Solar Rebate
state_rebate_programs.amount: Historically $0.30-$0.70/watt; program terms may change. Check current availability.
state_rebate_programs.details: Delaware has offered rebates for residential solar installations through the Green Energy Fund. Program availability and funding levels are subject to change.

programs.name: Home Performance Rebates
programs.amount: Varies; up to $2,000 for qualifying efficiency improvements
programs.eligible_items: HVAC upgrades, insulation, air sealing, smart thermostats, ENERGY STAR appliances

programs.name: Quick Home Energy Check-Up
programs.amount: Free or low-cost home energy assessment
programs.eligible_items: Energy assessment including free LED lighting and water-saving measures

programs.name: Appliance Rebates
programs.eligible_items: ENERGY STAR certified appliances including clothes washers, heat pump water heaters, smart thermostats

programs.name: Energy Efficiency Rebates
programs.eligible_items: Heat pumps, heat pump water heaters, LED lighting, smart thermostats

programs.name: Residential Efficiency Programs
programs.eligible_items: Energy-efficient appliances, lighting, HVAC equipment (availability varies by member municipality)
